channel.title: Public void declineTrade() errors
channel.description:
[code]client.java:8206: cannot find symbol symbol : variable hasAccepted location: class client if (!hasAccepted) { ^ client.java:8207: cannot find symbol symbol : variable playerTItems location: class client for (int i = 0; i < playerTItems.length; i++) { ^ client.java:8208: cannot find symbol symbol : variable playerTItems location: class client if (playerTItems > 0) { ^ client.java:8209: cannot find symbol symbol : variable tradeStatus location: class client if (tradeStatus < 4) { ^ client.java:8210: cannot find symbol symbol : variable playerTItems location: class client fromTrade((playerTItems - 1), i, playerTItemsN); ^ client.java:8210: cannot find symbol symbol : variable playerTItemsN location: class client fromTrade((playerTItems - 1), i, playerTItemsN); ^ 6 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Any idea how to fix?
Thanks for your time,
- RuneX -

item.title: Public void declineTrade() errors
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Nope, int is not the same as int[].

int is one integer.
int[] is an array of integers.

[quote=“RuneX-Gaming, post:5, topic:269125”]I added them somwhere else and got;

client.java:8210: operator ! cannot be applied to int if (!hasAccepted) { ^ client.java:8211: int cannot be dereferenced for (int i = 0; i < playerTItems.length; i++) { ^ client.java:8214: cannot find symbol symbol : variable playerTItemsN location: class client fromTrade((playerTItems - 1), i, playerTItemsN); ^ 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .

  • RuneX -[/quote]
    Try changing all

playerTItemsN -> playerItemsN
playerTItems -> playerItems

Read full topic

item.title: Public void declineTrade() errors
item.dc:creator: @noobie22 Noobie22
item.description:
@noobie22 wrote:

So when I add my public ints, I’m just taking the short-cut out of int[]?

item.title: Public void declineTrade() errors
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“noobie22, post:2, topic:269125”]You had to add the variables

public int playerTItems;
public int hasAccepted;
public int tradeStatus;

client.java:8206: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable hasAccepted
location: class client
if (!hasAccepted) {
^
client.java:8207: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable playerTItems
location: class client
for (int i = 0; i < playerTItems.length; i++) {
^
client.java:8208: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable playerTItems
location: class client
if (playerTItems > 0) {
^
client.java:8209: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable tradeStatus
location: class client
if (tradeStatus < 4) {
^
client.java:8210: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable playerTItems
location: class client
fromTrade((playerTItems - 1), i, playerTItemsN);
^
client.java:8210: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable playerTItemsN
location: class client
fromTrade((playerTItems - 1), i, playerTItemsN);
^
6 errors
Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]
No.

For one, you’ve told him to declare an integer when a boolean is required, also, declaring them would just be pointless anyway and you’ve declared an int when an int[] is required.
